TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class Writer : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.IO.ICloseable, Java.IO.IFlushable, Java.Lang.IAppendable

.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Writer extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class Java.IO.IFlushable, class Java.Lang.IAppendable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The base class for all writers.

remarks.para: The base class for all writers. A writer is a means of writing data to a target in a character-wise manner. Most output streams expect the method to be called before closing the stream, to ensure all data is actually written out.

This abstract class does not provide a fully working implementation, so it needs to be subclassed, and at least the , and methods needs to be overridden. Overriding some of the non-abstract methods is also often advised, since it might result in higher efficiency.

Many specialized readers for purposes like reading from a file already exist in this package.
See Also

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Java.Lang.IAppendable Append (Java.Lang.ICharSequence csq);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Lang.IAppendable Append(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence csq) cil managed

Docs.param: the character sequence appended to the target.
Docs.summary: Appends a subsequence of the character sequence csq to the target.

remarks.para: Appends the character sequence csq to the target. This method works the same way as Writer.write(csq.toString()). If csq is null, then the string "null" is written to the target stream.

Docs.exception: if this writer is closed or another I/O error occurs.

Docs.param: the character sequence appended to the target.
the index of the first char in the character sequence appended to the target.
the index of the character following the last character of the subsequence appended to the target.
Docs.summary: Appends a subsequence of the character sequence csq to the target.

remarks.para: Appends a subsequence of the character sequence csq to the target. This method works the same way as Writer.writer(csq.subsequence(start, end).toString()). If csq is null, then the specified subsequence of the string "null" will be written to the target.

Docs.exception: if this writer is closed or another I/O error occurs.
if start > end, start , end or either start or end are greater or equal than the length of csq.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Close ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Closes this writer.

remarks.para: Closes this writer. Implementations of this method should free any resources associated with the writer.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while closing this writer.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Flush ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Flush() cil managed

Docs.summary: Flushes this writer.

remarks.para: Flushes this writer. Implementations of this method should ensure that all buffered characters are written to the target.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while flushing this writer.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
